intro: Zephyranthes splendens, commonly known as the rain lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, white or pale pink flowers with a subtle fragrance, typically blooming after rainfall. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves that are usually evergreen, and it has a bulbous underground stem that aids in storage and propagation. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Zephyranthes splendens is known for its rapid growth and ability to bloom throughout the year in suitable climates.
